newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ sees 2.5 pct growth in March 97 yr - Treasury.
newsitem.headline: NZ sees 2.5 pct growth in March 97 yr - Treasury.

text.p: The New Zealand government said on Thursday it forecast growth of 2.5 percent in the year to March 1997.
For the 1997/98 year it projected growth of 3.7 percent, underpinned by the second round of tax cuts which take effect on July 1, 1997.
In its previous forecasts prepared for the budget in May, the government said GDP would rise 2.6 percent in 1996/97 and four percent in 1997/98 (March years).
Latest figures from Statistics New Zealand showed production based GDP rose 2.1 percent in the March 1996 year.
